snippet: Management moves at Time Inc. have to make anyone who cares about the journalistic integrity of the company’s magazines a little nervous.
abstract: Joe Nocera Op-Ed column analyzes Norman Pearlstine's return to Time Inc as chief content officer; notes terms of the management shakeup raise serious questions about the journalistic integrity of the company's magazines; holds Time seems determined to eliminate time-honored divide between business and editorial divisions.
lead_paragraph: Management moves at Time Inc. have to make anyone who cares about the journalistic integrity of the company’s magazines a little nervous.
